'Oleyl alcohol', 'octadecenol', or 'cis-9-octadecen-1-ol', is a fatty alcohol
coming from inedible beef fat. It is also found in fish oil. Its chemical
formula is 18 36 or CH 3(CH 2) 7-CH=CH-
(CH 2) 8OH.

It is a non-ionic, unsaturated fatty alcohol.

It has uses as a nonionic surfactant, emulsifier, emollient and thickener in
skin creams, lotions and many other cosmetic products, plasticizer for softening
fabrics, surfactant and hair coating in shampoos and hair conditioners, and a
carrier for medications.
